meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>folding fan</kanji> and since you don't "to folding fan" something, this word means <vocabulary>to fan</vocabulary> instead.
readingMnemonic: Imagine yourself trying <vocabulary>to fan</vocabulary> yourself with an <reading>青</reading> (あお) fan. For some reason blue fans feel cooler. Maybe it's because they're the color of ice/water?
